org.apache.river.test.spec.servicediscovery.event

Class ModifyAttrServiceChanged

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestEnvironment
      • org.apache.river.test.share.BaseQATest
        • org.apache.river.test.spec.servicediscovery.AbstractBaseTest
          • org.apache.river.test.spec.servicediscovery.event.ModifyAttrServiceChanged
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Test, TestEnvironment
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddAttrServiceChanged, SetAttrServiceChanged

    public class ModifyAttrServiceChanged
extends AbstractBaseTest
    This class verifies that the event mechanism defined by the LookupCache interface operates as specified with respect to serviceChanged events when the set of attributes associated with a set of registered services is modified.

      • construct

        public Test construct(QAConfig config)
               throws Exception
        Performs actions necessary to prepare for execution of the current test. 1. Starts N lookup services 2. Creates a service discovery manager that discovers the lookup services started above 3. Creates a template that will match the test services based on service type only
        Specified by:
        construct in interface TestEnvironment
        Overrides:
        construct in class AbstractBaseTest
        Parameters:
        config - the test properties
        Returns:
        Test to run.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any failure occurs during construct

      • applyTestDef

        protected void applyTestDef()
                     throws Exception
        Defines the actual steps of this particular test. 1. Registers the test service(s) along with an attribute, and verifies the registration was successful. 2. Creates a cache, registers with the event mechanism of the cache, and verifies that the cache and its event mechanism works as expected. 3. Changes the attributes through either modification, replacement or augmentation, and verifies that the expected number of serviceChanged/serviceRemoved/serviceAdded events are sent by the cache's event mechanism.
        Specified by:
        applyTestDef in class AbstractBaseTest
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getNewAttrs

        protected net.jini.core.entry.Entry[] getNewAttrs(net.jini.core.entry.Entry[] oldAttrs,
                                                  net.jini.core.entry.Entry[] chngAttr)
        Based on the how the current test is to change the service's set of attribute(s) (modification, replacement, or augmentation), this method constructs and returns the set of attributes that will result after the change is requested. This method should be over-ridden by tests that extend this class.
        Returns:
        the set of attributes that will result after the particular change is made to the test service's set of attribute(s).

      • changeAttributes

                         throws net.jini.core.lease.UnknownLeaseException,
                                RemoteException
        Based on the how the current test is to change the service's set of attribute(s) (modification, replacement, or augmentation), this method makes the request for the actual change. This method should be over-ridden by tests that extend this class.
        Throws:
        net.jini.core.lease.UnknownLeaseException
        RemoteException

      • changeAttrAndVerify

        protected void changeAttrAndVerify()
                            throws Exception
        For each registered test service, and for each lookup service with which each test service is registered, this method "changes" the associated attribute. Depending on the definition of the changeAttr() method, the change made to the attribute will take one of the following forms: -- modification -- replacement (set new attribute) -- augmentation (add a new attribute) After the attribute is changed, the success or failure of the change is verified by comparing the number of serviceChanged events received to the number expected. This method will return null if there are no problems. If the String returned by this method is non-null, then the test should declare failure and display the value returned by this method.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • createCacheAndVerify

        protected void createCacheAndVerify()
                             throws Exception
        This method creates a cache, registers with the local event mechanism of the cache, and verifies that the expected number of serviceAdded events are received. The event mechanism is configured to use matching criteria that includes no filter and a template consisting of only the class type of the various test service(s) that were registered. This method will return null if there are no problems. If the String returned by this method is non-null, then the test should declare failure and display the value returned by this method.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • createCacheAndVerify

        protected void createCacheAndVerify(net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceTemplate tmpl)
                             throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception

      • delayOnCache

        protected void delayOnCache()

      • registerAndVerify

        protected void registerAndVerify(long waitDur)
                          throws Exception
        This method registers the configured number of test service(s) with the configured number of lookup service(s) that were started during construct. Additionally, for each lookup service with which a given service is registered, this method associates the configured number of test attributes. After registration is complete, this method verifies that each registration was successful by performing a blocking lookup on the service discovery manager created during construct. To verify the success of each registration, a template reflecting both the class type of the registered service(s) and the exact, single attribute of the service (based on knowledge of how the method registerServices() registers attributes) is used in the call to lookup. This method will declare failure if either the number of registered services is 0, or the number of attributes is not 1. This method will return null if there are no problems. If the String returned by this method is non-null, then the test should declare failure and display the value returned by this method.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • verifyServiceRegistration

        protected void verifyServiceRegistration(Object[] expectedService,
                                         net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceTemplate[] lookupTmpl,
                                         long waitDur)
                                  throws Exception
